pr_title: [DOCS] Adds documentation for secondary authorization headers

timeline.message: [DOCS] Adds documentation for secondary authorization headers

timeline.bodyText:
This should be

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Authorization: es-secondary-authorization <TOKEN> <1>
          
          
            
            es-secondary-authorization: basic <TOKEN> <1>
          
      
    
    
  

Instead of "basic" we can support "bearer" or "apikey" there in the same was we support that for Authorization headers.
Basically, es-secondary-authorization has the same syntax as theAuthorization header.

-[float]
+[discrete]
+[[http-clients-secondary-authorization]]
+==== Secondary authorization
+
+Some APIs support secondary authorization headers for situations where you want
+tasks to run with a different set of credentials. For example, you can send the
+following header in addition to the basic authentication header:
+
+[source,shell]
+--------------------------------------------------
+Authorization: es-secondary-authorization <TOKEN> <1>
